cases it should be I guess. There is an 'e' missing in cass
auto value = getStateValue(****) if getStateValue returns a string itself

I guess we can directly write the return statement on convertProgressStagesFromString method. No need to use an extra variable bootProgessStage declared at line no 54 (thus avoiding invoking a function call to it's default constructor)
Same comment as on line no 63
Make the params as const std::string& if they are I/P in nature
If all the parameters are input params then can we make them as const std::string& for better clarity and avoid any accidental misuse/modification?
as this is generic method should it be state?
this method can be placed in the internal state or on .cpp file as we want users to call getHostState and getBootProgress and e.t.c. but ok if you want users to call this method for other states
Users can get state if needed
For my comments it is ok now although Devender's comments are still pending it seems
code change does not tally wih commit message, commit message says when dump is disabled and host moving to quiesced state. please correct.

If the dump is disabled and the system dump started the dump won't be collected and the system will be moved to the quiesced state, explained in the commit message. We need to attempt the dump quiesced state
